data.note: The lower cost of commodities has significantly improved Senelec's financial status. As of late 2015, the company stopped receiving compensation from the government and its balance sheet has improved due to better management, according to several developers. This has improved the risk perception among investors. Senelec's focus on diversifying its energy mix and bringing significant new generation onto the grid will make it less vulnerable to oil price fluctuations, which have been at the root of its financial issues in the past. Independent developers and financiers of the renewable projects we spoke to were confident that Senelec will honour long-term government-backed power purchase agreements.
data.name: Power offtake risk for independent generators
